item.title: Multimedia
item.content: <section><iframe allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="315" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/P5xVJJU2Bgo" width="420"></iframe><h3>Title: This Child is Deaf?</h3><p>When this video was made, Clementine was four years old. Believe it or not, she IS profoundly deaf. Clementine hears with the help of a cochlear implant, and she has learned to listen and speak at the Tucker-Maxon School in Portland, Oregon.</p><iframe allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="315" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/t8Ydnx0XBZM" width="560"></iframe><h3>Title: “Interview with Linda Kerlin”</h3><p>Portland Family Magazine publisher, Janna Lopez talks with Linda Kerlin, of Tucker Maxon School located in southeast Portland.</p><iframe allowfullscreen="" frameborder="0" height="315" src="http://www.youtube.com/embed/yg6Tolr5mRU" width="420"></iframe><h3>The History of Tucker Maxon Oral School - the first school-based cochlear implantation center”</h3><p>For sixty years Tucker-Maxon has been teaching deaf children to communicate through speech opening connections to the hearing world that would otherwise have remained closed.</p></section>
item.author: admin
